Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label two different land habitats, like a garden and a forest.
The student can draw and label two different water habitats, like a pond and a stream.
The student can include drawings of various plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can include drawings of different animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants for land habitats and fish, and clams for water habitats.
The student can show patterns in the types of living things present in the land habitats compared to those in the water habitats.
The student can organize and label their drawing to clearly show which living things belong to which habitat.
The student can demonstrate through their drawings how living things exist in different places on land and in water.
